txt.en: Free People must not control the Mine

'The mines are fallen to Angmar again and I will not stand for it, [placeholder]. We must get the mine back.

'I suggest that we use the drakes stalking the depths as cover for our attack. Search the lands south of Tol Ascarnen or west and south on the plains of the Steps of Gram for the Thistledown grazers. Collect haunches from those beasts and deliver them to a flat stone near where the Tyrant holding the mine keeps his company.

'The blood from the haunches should draw the drakes within range of the foe and bring about the battle needed to bring these foes down!'

Angmar once again holds the Isendeep Mine and Sergeant-at-Arms Thorfinn believes that the time has come to purge them from the depths to take the mine back for the Free People. He suggests a drastic measure to do so in an effort to defeat the foe.
The haunches are placed, the drakes are sure to come. You should hide.
The Free People control the mine, there is no reason to bring the beasts to bear.
Place the Thistledown haunches on the flat stone in the Isendeep

Search the areas south of Tol Ascarnen or west along the plains, south of DÃ¢r-gazag for the Thistledown Grazers. Collect some of their haunches and bring them to the slab within the depths of the Isendeep.\n\nSergeant-at-Arms Thorfinn believes that the drakes can be used against the Orcs of Angmar and wishes to use them as a diversion while you attack the Tyrant.
